channel.title: Address Already In Use Error
channel.description:
java.net.BindException: Address already in use
I get this simple exception which I normally know how to fix but this ones puzzling me.... I don't have another server running on 43594, why does it say the address is in use?

item.title: Address Already In Use Error
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:5, topic:542492”]Yep, that can happen. The server socket closes but the TCP ports sometimes stay open if you had clients connected. Usually you just have to wait a few minutes and then try again. I guess the long term solution is to fix the runtime exceptions.

For now, you could use a shutdown hook to close the client connections and server socket - http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/Runtime.html#addShutdownHook(java.lang.Thread)[/quote]

Alright sweet, I implemented it!

Read full topic

item.title: Address Already In Use Error
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Yep, that can happen. The server socket closes but the TCP ports sometimes stay open if you had clients connected. Usually you just have to wait a few minutes and then try again. I guess the long term solution is to fix the runtime exceptions.

For now, you could use a shutdown hook to close the client connections and server socket - http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/lang/Runtime.html#addShutdownHook(java.lang.Thread)

Read full topic

item.title: Address Already In Use Error
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Alright well I think I figured out where the issue is coming from but I do not know how to fix it. Basically, if the server errors and stops running, it doesn’t stop occupying the port.

Read full topic

item.title: Address Already In Use Error
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Try restarting the computer?

item.title: Address Already In Use Error
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

Maybe you have something like uTorrent blocking the connection. Check what applications you might have open.
